item.title: Marina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Marina add a quote by George Harrison
item.description: "If you don't know where you're going, any road'll take you there" -- George Harrison

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Marina add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Marina add a quote by Nelson Rodrigues
item.description: "Amar é ser fiel a quem nos trai." -- Nelson Rodrigues

item.title: Marina add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "What matters in life is not what happens to you but what you remember and how you remember it." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Marina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Nobody deserves your tears, but whoever deserves them will not make you cry." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Marina add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "But when a woman decides to sleep with a man, there is no wall she will not scale, no fortress she will not destroy, no moral consideration she will not ignore at its very root: there is no God worth worrying about." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Marina add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Marina add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's only after we've lost everything that we're free to do anything." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Marina add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Marina add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Marina add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Marina add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "The truth." Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Marina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "At eighteen our convictions are hills from which we look; at forty-five they are caves in which we hide." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Marina add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Marina add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "Expect nothing and you'll always be surprised" -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Marina add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "Fear of danger is ten thousand times more terrifying than danger itself." -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Marina add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "Tis very strange men should be so fond of being wickeder than they are." -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Marina add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "I hear much of people's calling out to punish the guilty, but very few are concerned to clear the innocent." -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Marina add a quote by Max Weber
item.description: "Politics is a strong and slow boring of hard boards. It takes both passion and perspective. Certainly all historical experience confirms the truth - that man would not have attained the possible unless time and again he had reached out for the impossible. But to do that a man must be a leader, and not only a leader but a hero as well, in a very sober sense of the word. And even those who are neither leaders nor heroes must arm themselves with that steadfastness of heart which can brave even the crumbling of all hopes. This is necessary right now, or else men will not be able to attain even that which is possible today." -- Max Weber

item.title: Marina add a quote by Max Weber
item.description: "It is true that the path of human destiny cannot but appal him who surveys a section of it. But he will do well to keep his small personal commentarie to himself, as one does at the sight of the sea or of majestic mountains, unless he knows himself to be called and gifted to give them expression in artistic or prophetic form. In most other cases, the voluminous talk about intuition does nothing but conceal a lack of perspective toward the object, which merits the same judgement as a similar lack of perspective toward men." -- Max Weber

item.title: Marina add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Marina add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that's beautiful." -- Milan Kundera
